news.description: Our legal system is built upon the fundamental principle of a right to a fair trial by a jury of one’s peers; but can we consider the trial fair if the jury is not? Can an underrepresentation of marginalized communities of color in the jury truly deem a trial as fair, accurate, and reliable?
